oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Anfälligkeit von Leguminosen gegenüber Meloidogyne hapla
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Reents, Dr. H. J.
Egerer, Johanna
Hermann, A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Crop combinations and interactions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Green manure legumes are a necessary element of organic crop rotations. However, they are able to propagate nematodes especially Meloidogyne and Paratylenchus species. The results of a pot experiment showed that plant species of the genera Pisum, Vicia, Trifolium had a higher propagation rate of Meloidogyne hapla than salad Latuca sativa while plant species of the genera Medicago and Melilotus were less susceptible to infestation of nematodes. It is concluded that crop rotation management especially in vegetable production has to consider the different susceptibility of the legumes and further research has to test more species and varieties.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Reents, Dr. H. J.; Egerer, Johanna and Hermann, A. (2009) Anfälligkeit von Leguminosen gegenüber Meloidogyne hapla. Paper at: 10. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Zürich, 11.-13. Februar 2009.
